definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: When that day comes to you, the broke up that you have been through just was a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 當那一天到來，你所經歷的分手只不過是小事一樁。

sentences.english: With the view in place, constructing the source query is a snap.
sentences.chinese: 視圖就緒後，構造數據源查詢就是小事一樁。

sentences.english: That is but a trifle, when a woman knows the world.
sentences.chinese: 只要一個女人看透了這個世界，這原本是小事一樁。

sentences.english: But these were mere trifles; and they assured their mother that the experiment was working finely.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這些都只是小事一樁，她們告訴母親進展順利。

sentences.english: If we were writing similar functions in a heap environment, it would have been trivial.
sentences.chinese: 在堆環境中編寫類似的功能只是小事一樁。

sentences.english: Originally a trifle, how to value care in the heart?
sentences.chinese: 本來就小事一樁，怎值掛礙在心頭？

sentences.english: A trifle, Yang wide acquaintance that it is not a thing?
sentences.chinese: 小事一樁，楊總路子廣熟人多這不算個事兒吧？

sentences.english: B:There's no reason to apologize for such a trifling thing.
So for them, this is a minor matter.
sentences.chinese: 因此對他們來說，這是小事一樁。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to whisper to one another's ear
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to have no sense of shame/brazen
